fields.name: Festejar
fields.description: This is the cutest wine there is. Slightly sweet and finely bubbly gamay d'auvergne from the Bouju wizard. It's running too wild!
fields.tastes_good_for: A cute sweater and no underpants

fields.name: Prosa
fields.description: Bubbling adult juice FTW. This is so easy and refreshing and wonderful and bearable and well made. There is plenty of fruit squeezed into the acid trip, and the yeast tone is surprisingly (and liberatingly) low for a round of pætnaaaat (as they say it on Funen!). Hahaha. Buy 100 bottles right away.

fields.name: Henri Dosnon
fields.description: Champagne available on all parameters. Fermented in steel tanks and therefore perfectly fresh and mineral. However, also gets a little dosage to provide balance. Instant and friendly baboon juice.

fields.name: Pinky Wave
fields.grapes: Barbera, cabernet franc, pinot nero, merlot, trebbiano
fields.description: Pink plum juice!!! This is really nice and fun and bubbly and wild. It tastes of poulsard on a  bucketful of sour coke, which is sniffed from a freshly polished samurai sword. Irk. It's a lot of fun and interesting and wonderfully easy to bellow.

fields.name: Govin
fields.description: Wild and wonderful bubble juice from Funen. It is made in the champagne method - but without disgorging, so it is a plummeting dryness you push into the mouth. And hey man, just remember that the wine must be cold and the glasses

fields.name: O-X
fields.description: Because you have a bottle of Costadila juice standing in the background, your pretentious and self-centered friends choose your event over a really bold and trending popup on Falang. And then you have won in life itself.

fields.name: Moon Bulle
fields.description: If Armstrong and those two other astro-types were to drink something sweaty on the moon the next time they go up there, then this should definitely be it.

fields.name: Arôme Rouge
fields.description: Just check the color of this plaffer juice? You just know it good!

fields.name: Rosso di Valtellina
fields.description: This is a classic and nice nebbiolo

fields.name: Le Trame
fields.description: Classic and wonderful sangiovese with a bit of seriousness. Just let the rainstorms come and the winter storm hits.

fields.name: Les Paradetes
fields.description: The badger is the new fox.
fields.tastes_good_for: Days with shotguns and good friends.

fields.name: Dope
fields.description: What should I write about it, other than….dope!!

fields.name: Mr. Baumann
fields.description: Many people think that Portuguese people taste a little dark and scratchy. In a bad way, of course. But when Florian sprinkles his unicorn dust over his Portuguese grapes, it turns into completely light and aromatic wine.

fields.name: Le Pinotctambule
fields.description: The boss's son is also good at making wine.

fields.name: Le Ginglet
fields.description: It tastes really good!

fields.name: L'ivresse des Profondeurs
fields.description: 80’s vibes

fields.name: 380 Volts
fields.description: A pleasant shock to the system
fields.tastes_good_for: Asphalt laying in a warm environment

fields.name: Agape Savagnin Ouillé
fields.description: Tall and lively and just the kind of thing you like;)

fields.name: Aligoté Burgundy
fields.description: It's just extremely precise and straightforward and utterly glorious. Huge run on crisp wine (and then the label is also lovely if you are that type.
fields.tastes_good_for: Seafood (and that applies to you, Mr. Oysters!)

fields.name: Amalgamé
fields.description: beauty personified

fields.name: Barracuda
fields.description: Aromatic and wild jazz wine. It's really crisp and vibrant and nice and understandable.  Lots of structure and finesse and balance.  It is dangerously easy to drink.

fields.name: Bianco
fields.description: This is damn top of the pop when it comes to natural wine with nerve, wildness, depth and psychopathic balance. It is both big and mouthwatering. And infinitely interesting. It is such a bottle you should always have lying in your basement.

fields.name: Desvelao
fields.description: Whuuuuut ?! Moscatell in the driest way with seven months under bloom. Oooohyyyyes, this one tastes big and good and wild and real.

fields.name: Dharma
fields.producer: Sons of Wine / Farid Yahimi / Jean-Marc Dreyer
fields.description: Psychedelic

fields.name: Fawn
fields.description: Cuuuuuuute

fields.name: Coteaux Bourguignons Rosé
fields.description: Because this is summer in a bottle, even if you bully it in February. Ultra-complex and yet death-defying rosé from the upcoming cult winemaker, who is Romain Chapuis.

fields.name: Freaky
fields.description: This wine is the essence of a wild aromatic and refreshing style. It's a party firework of aromatics and peacock feathers and Pirlo passes inside your mouth.
fields.tastes_good_for: Drinking extra chilled while feeling extra wild

fields.name: Devín
fields.description: A Clockwork Orange in a bottle

fields.name: Light-red No. 29
fields.description: Soooo, this is elegant. Like Britt Bendix

fields.name: Speedball
fields.description: This would be the rosé of the year in Ebberup if there was such a competition there.  There isn’t.

fields.name: Rosato
fields.description: Legendary rosé from the very intense Gianmarco.  This is a cult rosé

fields.name: Bum Bum Cha
fields.description: Tastes like the rainbow just before it appears

fields.name: Organic
fields.description: The man behind Organic Anarchy is named Aci Urbajs. Super bold type that is both tall and good at making wild wine. This is wild and deep and funny and did we say wild?
